result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharita Charnett Fanroy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sharita Charnett Fanroy appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Sharita Charnett Fanroy.  Attorney Samir Siddique in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 30.

Defendant Sharita Charnett Fanroy in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sharita Charnett Fanroy appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sharita Charnett Fanroy in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sharita Charnett Fanroy appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense asks for meore time to review case with client. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant left without getting her No Contact Order. Mailing it to her at the address she has on the PR slip.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with G.P. and C.H.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sharita Charnett Fanroy in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-21-2022 @2p
